title: 106_s2605
content: The "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen. The "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen by amending the Internal Revenue Code to include fishing businesses in the definition of elected farm income. The "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" includes fishing businesses in the definition of elected farm income, allowing income averaging for fishermen conducting commercial fishing activities. The "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" includes a new section in the Internal Revenue Code offering a credit for the purchase of fishing safety equipment. The "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" introduces a tax credit for eligible taxpayers who purchase qualified fishing safety equipment. The credit is 75% of the expenses incurred, up to a maximum of $1,500, for taxpayers engaged in a fishing business. The tax credit introduced by the "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows eligible taxpayers to claim a deduction for equipment expenses related to fishing safety equipment used in their fishing business. The fishing safety equipment must meet specific lifesaving requirements outlined in the law. Special rules and aggregation rules apply, and no double benefits are allowed under this chapter except for the credit provided in this section. The tax credit for fishing safety equipment introduced by the "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows eligible taxpayers to claim a deduction for equipment expenses. No double benefits are allowed under this chapter except for the credit provided in this section. Basis of equipment is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed. Carryback of fishing safety equipment credit is limited before the effective date. The fishing safety equipment credit under section 45D can be carried to a taxable year before the enactment of the section. Section 38(b) and section 1016 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to include the fishing safety equipment credit. The text introduces a new paragraph (28) related to equipment eligible for a credit under section 45D. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this Act, including the fishing safety equipment credit under section 45D, will be effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2000.
